title: Strings
concept: This level strengthens string manipulation skills in Python—length, counting characters, vowels, reversing, palindrome check, searching substrings, and frequency. Do NOT add extra debug text in the output; follow required format strictly.

challenges.title: String Length
challenges.description: Read a string and print its length.

challenges.title: Count Vowels
challenges.description: Count the number of vowels (a,e,i,o,u in both cases) in the string.

challenges.title: Count Consonants
challenges.description: Count consonants (alphabet but not vowel). Ignore digits and symbols.

challenges.title: Reverse String
challenges.description: Print the reverse of the string.

challenges.title: Palindrome Check
challenges.description: Check if the string is palindrome. Print Yes if palindrome else No.

challenges.title: Copy String
challenges.description: Read string S1 and print a copy S2 (simply print same string).
challenges.starterCode:
s1 = input()
# create s2 = s1 and print

challenges.title: Concatenate Strings
challenges.description: Read S1 and S2 and print concatenated S1S2 (no space).
challenges.inputDescription: Two strings S1 and S2 on separate lines.
challenges.starterCode:
s1 = input().strip()
s2 = input().strip()
# print concatenation

challenges.title: First Occurrence
challenges.description: Print the index of first occurrence of character X in string S. If not found print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line S, second line X.
challenges.starterCode:
s = input()
x = input().strip()
# find index of first occurrence

challenges.title: Word Count
challenges.description: Count number of words in a sentence. Words are separated by spaces.
examples:
Input:
Hello world from Python
Output:
4

challenges.title: Character Frequency
challenges.description: Count how many times each lowercase alphabet a–z appears and print in 26 lines a:x format.
challenges.starterCode:
s = input().lower()
# count frequency a to z
